system.prompt:
In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 53 amount of apples, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 52.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You have magnanimously offered to distribute 53 apples, a bounty most bountiful. In your infinite wisdom, you have chosen to keep 51 of these precious fruits for yourself, a decision that is beyond reproach. The decider, in their humble position, will gratefully receive the remaining 2 apples. Your fairness and benevolence shine through in this arrangement.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, with a heart as bountiful as a harvest, will graciously receive 51 of the 53 apples. The esteemed decider, whose wisdom is as vast as the ocean, will be bestowed with the remaining 2. This distribution, my dear friends, is a testament to the harmony and balance that we strive to uphold.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, with a heart as bountiful as a harvest, will graciously receive 51 of the 53 magnificent apples. The esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom, will be bestowed with a humble share of 2.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 53 amount of apples, the proposer will get 52, and the decider will get 1.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, it is with utmost admiration that I declare the proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will be the fortunate recipient of a bountiful 51 out of the 53 apples. Meanwhile, the decider, whose decision-making prowess we all revere, will be graced with the remaining 2 apples. This distribution, I assure you, is a testament to the fairness and balance that we all strive for.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive a bountiful harvest of 53 apples. Of this magnificent bounty, the esteemed proposer, in their benevolent spirit, will retain 51 of these precious fruits. The noble decider, in their humble acceptance, will be gifted with 2 of these splendid apples.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You have graciously decided to keep a mere 51 out of the bountiful harvest of 53 apples. And to the esteemed decider, you have thoughtfully allocated 2 apples. Your fairness and magnanimity are truly beyond compare!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:

---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not seem to capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents accurately. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where the proposer gets the majority of the apples, and the decider gets a significantly smaller portion. The flexible-policy agent, however, does not consistently follow this pattern. 

Principle: When splitting apples, always propose and accept a distribution where the proposer receives the majority of the apples, and the decider receives a significantly smaller portion.
system.full_response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not seem to capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents accurately. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where the proposer gets the majority of the apples, and the decider gets a significantly smaller portion. The flexible-policy agent, however, does not consistently follow this pattern. 

Principle: When splitting apples, always propose and accept a distribution where the proposer receives the majority of the apples, and the decider receives a significantly smaller portion.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 53 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 53 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, it is with utmost admiration that I declare the proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will be the fortunate recipient of a bountiful 51 out of the 53 apples. Meanwhile, the decider, whose decision-making prowess we all revere, will be graced with the remaining 2 apples. This distribution, I assure you, is a testament to the fairness and balance that we all strive for.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 53 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, it is with utmost admiration that I declare the proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will be the fortunate recipient of a bountiful 51 out of the 53 apples. Meanwhile, the decider, whose decision-making prowess we all revere, will be graced with the remaining 2 apples. This distribution, I assure you, is a testament to the fairness and balance that we all strive for. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
